entry.title: User Stories and Acceptance Criteria
entry.content: Launch Academy uses User Stories and Acceptance Criteria to demonstrate how different people mean different things when they say the same things. It clicked for all of us that the “cost of change” is cheap when one has not implemented any code. As soon as code has been implemented the cost of change is “high”. I like how Dan Picket said that user stories and acceptance criteria serve the purpose of “getting a conversation started”. It is not about who “won” the right-wrong contest and blaming each other. I love the word “started” as it means you are opening a door to exchange ideas and explain yourself.

entry.title: Pair Programming
entry.content:
Pair Programming is part of the daily routine at Launch Academy. One thing for sure: Together you can achieve more than on your own. I was really impressed. It has been a really good experience to observe you and your peers complement each other and be creative in what to try or where to look next. And for sure you will learn another “trick” from the other person that simplifies your future programming life.

Comraderie is very important in the industry, you cannot survive on your “own”. We need each other as people. “People first” and “opensource” are the keywords of the Ruby Community. And even as they move to other technologies these two will stay.

entry.title: Object Oriented Programming
entry.content: The shift from writing smaller ruby programs to OOP is that instead of hashes, arrays and strings one is passing objects with attributes around. I still cannot get my head around the physicality of objects and the most insipiring talk at Euruko 2013 for me was the one about the garbage collector.

entry.title: Ice Skating in Boston
entry.content:
November 2013 I joined the winter cohort of Launch Academy in Boston.

I was first introduced to Ruby on Rails at a @railsgirls_bln event in May 2012. End of August 2012 I joined a project group called the @rubymonster hosted by Travis CI. OpenTechSchool Berlin and Rails Girls Berlin events and people have been an integral part of my learnings.

Ever since I am enjoying ice-skating in Boston common or Kendall square.
